com.brianmearns.crafter

Class ValueBuilder.NeverValueBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brianmearns.crafter.ValueBuilder<T>
      • com.brianmearns.crafter.ValueBuilder.NeverValueBuilder<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<T>, com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
    Enclosing class:
    ValueBuilder<T>

    protected static class ValueBuilder.NeverValueBuilder<T>
extends ValueBuilder<T>
    A ValueBuilder which doesn't actually do anything.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        @NotNull
protected ValueBuilder<T> set(@NotNull
                          com.google.common.base.Supplier<T> value)
        Description copied from class: ValueBuilder
        Helper method to set the value that will be used by ValueBuilder.get() to return a new instance. This is a helper method which ValueBuilder.set(Builder) and ValueBuilder.set(Object) delegate to. The public interface does not allow generic Supplier objects to be used to set the value.
        Specified by:
        set in class ValueBuilder<T>
        Returns:
        This ValueBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.

      • apply

        @NotNull
protected ValueBuilder<T> apply(@NotNull
                            com.google.common.base.Function<ValueBuilder<T>,java.lang.Void> function)
        Description copied from class: ValueBuilder
        Apply the given function to this object, and return this object again.

        This is simply a way to add some arbitrary code in the middle of a chain of method invocations. You could use the Function to perform some complex logic to configure the builder, for instance.

        The return value of the function is ignored, but for safety and clarity, it should be a void return.

        Specified by:
        apply in class ValueBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        function - The Function to be invoked on this object.
        Returns:
        This ValueBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.

      • get

        @Nullable
public T get()
        Description copied from class: ValueBuilder
        Build the value (if needed) and return it. If a value was given (as with ValueBuilder.set(Object)), then it is simply returned. If a builder for a value was given (as with ValueBuilder.set(Builder)), then this method delegates to that's builder's Builder.get() method.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Builder<T>
        Specified by:
        get in interface com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
        Specified by:
        get in class ValueBuilder<T>
        Returns:
        The built value.

      • maybe

        @NotNull
public ValueBuilder<T> maybe(boolean yes)
        Description copied from class: ValueBuilder
        Returns a builder which either does or doesn't delegate to this builder based on the given boolean.
        Specified by:
        maybe in class ValueBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        yes - If true, then methods invoked on the returned builder will modify the state of this builder. Otherwise, methods invoked on the returned builder will not modify state.

      • endMaybe

        @NotNull
public ValueBuilder<T> endMaybe()
        Description copied from class: ValueBuilder
        Returns the parent builder of a conditional builder. This is not necessarily the originating top level builder if you have nested (or rather chained) calls to ValueBuilder.maybe(boolean).
        Specified by:
        endMaybe in class ValueBuilder<T>
